title-group.article-title: Chaos Misread: Or, There's Wonton in My Soup!

ref.mixed-citation: N. J. Girardot, specifically his article on "Chaos" in The Encyclopedia of Religion (Eliade), and his book, Myth and Meaning in Early Taoism.
Bernhard Anderson, Creation Versus Chaos (1967)
Hermann Gunkel's classic Schöpfung und Chaos in Urzeit und Endzeit (1895).
Paul Ricoeur, The Symbolism of Evil (1967),
Finitude et culpabilité: La symbolique du mal (1960).
(Eliade 217).

Wolf: "... recent progress in the field of nonlinear dynamics demonstrates that simple deterministic mathematical models can explain several of the experimentally ob- served routes to chaos. Especially surprising are the predictions that certain features of chaos are 'universal', that is, largely independent of a system's detailed structure" (182).
Renditions 1 (1973): 20.
Anderson, Bernhard. Creation versus Chaos: The Reinterpretation of Mythical Symbolism in the Bible. New York: Association, 1967.
Chen, Ellen Marie. "Nothingness and the Mother Principle in Early Chinese Taoism." International Philsophical Quarterly 9 (1969): 391-405.
Eliade, Mircea, ed. The Encyclopedia of Religion. New York: Macmillan, 1987.
Girardot, N. J. Myth and Meaning in Early Taoism: The Theme of Chaos (hun-tun). Berkeley: U of California P, 1983.
Gleick, James. Chaos: The Making of a New Science. New York: Viking Penguin, 1987.
Gunkel, Hermann. Schöpferung und Chaos in Urzeit und Endzeit. Gôttingen: Vandenhoeck und Ruprecht, 1895.
Hall, David L. "Process and Anarchy--A Taoist Vision of Creativity." Philosophy East and West 28:3 (July 1978): 271-85.
Legge, James. The Texts of Taoism. Volume 1. New York: Dover, 1962.
Pritchard, J. B., ed. Ancient Near Eastern Texts Relating to the Old Testament, 3nd ed. Princeton: Princeton UP, 1958.
Ricoeur, Paul. The Symbolism of Evil New York: Harper Torchbook, 1967.
Watson, Burton, trans. The Complete Works of Chuang Tzu. New York: Columbia UP, 1968.
Wolf, Alan. "Simplicity and universality in the transition to chaos." Nature 305 (15 September 1983): 182-83.
Yu, David C. "The Creation Myth and Its Symbolism in Classical Taoism." Philosophy East and West 31:4 (October 1981): 479-500.
